issues.fullMessage: Since the compiler will automatically invoke the base type's no-argument constructor, there's no need to specify its invocation explicitly. Also, when only a single "public" parameterless constructor is defined in a class, then that constructor can be removed because the compiler would generate it automatically. Similarly, empty "static" constructors and empty destructors are also wasted keystrokes.

properties.title: Constructor and destructor declarations should not be redundant
